comment: Eco Mode adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.OCF/master/ecomode/schema.json
description: Smart Data Models Program adaptation of the original IoTData data Models. This Resource specifies the supported and currently active Eco Mode of a Device The Resource is a deriviative of the Mode Resource (oic.r.mode) with a restriction that the population of supportedmodes and modes Properties is restricted to the set of values: 'disabled','enabled','notsupported'. The adminforced Property indicates that the value has been set by another party (e.g. via some offboard Smart Energy interaction)

contents.name: adminforced
contents.comment: The indicator that the current mode of operation has been forced by admin action.

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object

contents.name: if
contents.comment: The OCF Interface set supported by this Resource.

contents.name: modes
contents.comment: The array of the currently active mode(s).

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: supportedModes
contents.comment: The array of possible modes the device supports.
